message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM

Reasoning: The paper deals with the problem of matching partial scans of nonrigid objects to their full, articulated counterparts, and reconstructing the new pose from the partial observation. This involves tasks such as shape completion and dense shape correspondence, which are typically studied in the computer vision (cs.CV) and computer graphics (cs.GR) communities. The approach is data-driven and uses a Siamese autoencoder, which suggests a machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) perspective. Finally, the paper also mentions applications on synthetic and real-world geometric data, which could fall under the multimedia (cs.MM) category.
